main event: On 12 Jan 59, an object resembling a round, blue-green, half-dollar-sized object was observed 30 yards south of Oceanside, California. It appeared brighter than any aircraft and was observed traveling at a much greater speed. The witnesses estimated its course to be 111 degrees.
interesting points: The object looked like F4D exhaust but was traveling at a much greater speed.
The observation lasted for approximately 2 seconds.
The Commander of the aircraft reported that the object was more powerful than another aircraft and he was unable to determine the distance to the object.
The speed of the object was estimated to be Mach 2 or 3 if it was close, and much greater if it was at a great distance.
This was the second sighting reported in the San Diego area that night, with the first one being considered possibly aircraft lights and not recorded.
sighted object: Round, blue-green object the size of a half-dollar
witnesses: Commander Moore from VAH4, North Island
